title: Patch 7.20 Ping Issues?
body:
I usually use the practice tool to test my ping before starting any ranked or normal games.
A good ping for me is a steady 38-40. When using the practice tool, my ping in-game is perfectly fine. This is when I'm using it alone.
When I begin a normal/ranked game, however, my ping will spike to over 300-400, making the game unplayable and forcing me to DC. 
I've done everything i know to fix this issue, even calling my internet provider (nothing seems wrong on that end)
I'm wondering if this is a patch issue or game issue, because i have no clue what else it could be.

replies.body: I also have been having the same issue. Lag will randomly spike to 300+ MS. Never before have I lagged as my MS is normally around 30-40.

This sounds like potential packet loss causing spikes like that.  In this case, run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) on these impacted games for an overview, and let me know what you find!

About time someone else said this other the me straight to MouseRat in a support ticket.

Basically i did all the same as you and even went a step further by having my ISP send over a tech to look at everything and swap the router out with a new one.

Lets just say there should not be a problem if there was one on my end or the ISP's end of things.

and don't ya know, im still having the problem.

Based on what MouseRat said, that a patch or server causing issues is a rare bug if it did even happen. I am putting my money on the "Rare Bug" and saying it is the patch or server causing the connection problem.

I also noticed that threw all the other posts with the same problem from the current patch, it is not just located in the NA server but also in EUW as well, so it seems a bit more people are sharing the problem over the world to be common coincidence.

But yeah if you manage to figure it out, do pass on the knowledge ive been having the problem for more the a week now its rough when its the first time you have the problem since you had your ISP for a year.
